newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka rupee closes up on lack of imports.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka rupee closes up on lack of imports.

text.p: The Sri Lanka rupee closed sharply up against the dollar on Monday, due to a lack of import covering and overseas losses by the dollar, dealers said.
The rupee closed at 58.35 to the dollar after opening at 58.55, they said.
"A lack of imports led to low demand for dollars," said an American Express bank dealer. "And overseas weakness of the dollar and a demand for call money kept speculators away."
Overnight call money rates closed at 13 percent after opening at 11.5 percent, due to a big state bank borrowing, dealers said.
